questions.question: Which of the following is an essential element of Nigeria’s airworthiness regulatory system?
questions.correctAnswer: Registration of aircraft
questions.hint: It relates to keeping the national register of aircraft.
questions.funFact: The PPM lists registration of aircraft as a core element of the airworthiness system.

questions.question: Who is responsible for appointing Principal Airworthiness Inspectors (PAIs) and allocating ASIs?
questions.correctAnswer: Director, Airworthiness Standards (DAWS)
questions.hint: This is the internal directorate that manages DAWS staff and appointments.
questions.funFact: PAIs are nominated by sectional management and approved by the Director, DAWS.

questions.question: Which document should an inspector consult for guidance on technical inspection procedures?
questions.correctAnswer: Technical Guidance Manual Vol. IV
questions.hint: It’s the Airworthiness Inspector Handbook volume.
questions.funFact: DAWS points inspectors to the Technical Guidance Manuals for inspector procedures.

questions.question: Which activity is explicitly included in DAWS functions?
questions.correctAnswer: Issuance/renewal of Certificates of Airworthiness
questions.hint: Think certificate that says an aircraft is fit to fly.
questions.funFact: The PPM lists issue/renewal of Certificates of Airworthiness as a primary DAWS task.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT listed as a DAWS governing material?
questions.correctAnswer: International Shipping Code
questions.hint: DAWS references aviation-specific legal and guidance documents.
questions.funFact: DAWS references the Civil Aviation Act, Nig.CARs and several Technical Guidance Manuals.

questions.question: What is the TFCC/Registry responsible for?
options: Safe custody of files and register of file movements
questions.correctAnswer: Safe custody of files and register of file movements
questions.hint: TFCC handles file movement and storage.
questions.funFact: TFCC must keep a movement register recording who took/returned files and when.

questions.question: If an ASI takes a file for action, within how many working days should it normally be returned to TFCC?
questions.correctAnswer: 5 working days
questions.hint: Short timeframe to keep files circulating.
questions.funFact: The manual specifies a 5-working-day normal return period for files.

questions.question: Which files may only be opened by the TFCC/Registry?
options: Operator files, AOC/AMO files and Special Purpose/Project files
questions.correctAnswer: Operator files, AOC/AMO files and Special Purpose/Project files
questions.hint: These are formal technical files used by DAWS.
questions.funFact: TFCC opens official operator and project files and assigns file numbers.

questions.question: What must TFCC/Registry do if a file is too bulky (over 100 folios)?
options: Close it and open a new volume
Send it to the archive immediately
questions.correctAnswer: Close it and open a new volume
questions.hint: They manage physical volumes to avoid oversized files.
questions.funFact: Large files (over ~100 folios) are closed and a new volume created by TFCC.

questions.question: When files are dispatched between regional offices and headquarters, what should accompany them?
options: Proper bagging, addressing and a recorded receipt
questions.correctAnswer: Proper bagging, addressing and a recorded receipt
questions.hint: Records and packaging are required for safe custody.
questions.funFact: Dispatch requires proper bagging and acknowledgement of receipt.

questions.question: What is Mandatory Occurrence Reporting (MOR) primarily used for?
questions.correctAnswer: Safety reporting and incident analysis
questions.hint: MOR feeds into safety deficiency programmes.
questions.funFact: MORs support the Safety Deficiency and Incident Analysis programme under the State Safety Programme.

questions.question: Who should be informed when major defects are discovered in aircraft?
options: Aircraft operators/owners and approved airworthiness organisations
questions.correctAnswer: Aircraft operators/owners and approved airworthiness organisations
questions.hint: Defects must be reported to those responsible for corrective action.
questions.funFact: The PPM requires reporting defects to operators and approved organisations for remedial action.

questions.question: Which activity is part of DAWS actions after discovering a defect trend?
options: Establish a Service Difficulty Reporting (SDR) system and analyze trends
questions.correctAnswer: Establish a Service Difficulty Reporting (SDR) system and analyze trends
questions.hint: They must analyze defect experience to detect and correct trends.
questions.funFact: DAWS uses SDRs and defect analysis to identify areas needing airworthiness improvement.

questions.question: If an aircraft is suspected of not being airworthy, what should be done?
options: Treat it as unairworthy and withdraw from service
questions.correctAnswer: Treat it as unairworthy and withdraw from service
questions.hint: Safety-first approach when airworthiness is in doubt.
questions.funFact: Suspected unairworthy aircraft should have their Certificate of Airworthiness revoked until inspected and corrected.

questions.question: Which DAWS duty directly supports safety response to service bulletins and airworthiness directives?
options: Monitoring service bulletins and issuing airworthiness directives where necessary
questions.correctAnswer: Monitoring service bulletins and issuing airworthiness directives where necessary
questions.hint: This protects the national fleet when foreign directives apply.
questions.funFact: DAWS reviews foreign directives and directs corrective action if national aircraft are affected.

questions.question: Which DAWS function covers approval of Approved Maintenance Organisations (AMOs)?
options: Approval of AMOs and periodic surveillance of AMOs
questions.correctAnswer: Approval of AMOs and periodic surveillance of AMOs
questions.hint: This concerns maintenance organisations’ certification and surveillance.
questions.funFact: DAWS surveys maintenance facilities and approves AMOs (domestic & foreign).

questions.question: What activity is specifically listed under AMOC&S responsibilities?
options: Inspection of fuel farms and aviation fuelling equipment
questions.correctAnswer: Inspection of fuel farms and aviation fuelling equipment
questions.hint: Fuel handling procedures fall under airworthiness surveillance.
questions.funFact: Fuel farm inspections are included in AMOC&S surveillance duties.

questions.question: Which approval is DAWS involved in for continuing airworthiness management?
options: Approval of Continuing Airworthiness Management Exposition (CAME) and CAMO activities
questions.correctAnswer: Approval of Continuing Airworthiness Management Exposition (CAME) and CAMO activities
questions.hint: This is about the operator's continuing airworthiness management system.
questions.funFact: DAWS reviews and approves CAME and CAMO functions for operators.

questions.question: What action does DAWS take when an inspection indicates non-compliance that may require enforcement?
options: Proceed with compliance and enforcement procedures
Transfer the aircraft to another operator
questions.correctAnswer: Proceed with compliance and enforcement procedures
questions.hint: Serious breaches trigger formal enforcement steps.
questions.funFact: DAWS coordinates compliance/enforcement activities and sanctions per regulations.

questions.question: Which of these is part of DAWS surveillance of AOC holders?
options: Monitoring operator maintenance training programs and reliability programmes
questions.correctAnswer: Monitoring operator maintenance training programs and reliability programmes
questions.hint: Surveillance includes operators' maintenance systems and training.
questions.funFact: DAWS evaluates maintenance systems, MELs and reliability programmes for operators.

questions.question: What basic qualifications are required for Airworthiness Aviation Safety Inspectors (ASI)?
options: Either experienced licensed maintenance engineers with ~5 years experience or relevant engineering graduates
questions.correctAnswer: Either experienced licensed maintenance engineers with ~5 years experience or relevant engineering graduates
questions.hint: Inspector qualifications emphasize technical competence and experience.
questions.funFact: Inspectors should be as qualified as the staff they oversee; five years’ industry experience is cited.

questions.question: What must inspectors submit to the training coordinator after completing a course?
questions.correctAnswer: Course certificates within two weeks
questions.hint: Training records must be kept up to date.
questions.funFact: Training folders are updated upon receipt of certificates and kept for two years after an inspector leaves.

questions.question: Which documents are listed as part of an inspector's training folder?
options: Copy of NCAA ID, credentials, CV, licences and training records
questions.correctAnswer: Copy of NCAA ID, credentials, CV, licences and training records
questions.hint: The folder holds professional credentials and training history.
questions.funFact: Training folders include Inspector credentials, CV, licences and OJT progress charts.

questions.question: What is an ASI expected to do if asked for an interpretation of regulations outside their expertise?
options: Require a written request so it can be coordinated with DAWS and Legal
questions.correctAnswer: Require a written request so it can be coordinated with DAWS and Legal
questions.hint: Complex interpretations must be coordinated centrally.
questions.funFact: The PPM advises that significant regulatory interpretations be coordinated with DAWS and Legal.

questions.question: Which personal attributes does the PPM emphasise for ASIs?
options: Impartiality, tact, integrity and good interpersonal skills
questions.correctAnswer: Impartiality, tact, integrity and good interpersonal skills
questions.hint: Inspectors must win operators' respect and act professionally.
questions.funFact: Beyond technical competence, high integrity and tact are core inspector qualities in the PPM.

questions.question: Which is a listed step for preparing for a technical audit of a regional office?
options: Acquire the latest technical manuals and study recent DAWS monthly reports
questions.correctAnswer: Acquire the latest technical manuals and study recent DAWS monthly reports
questions.hint: Preparation includes updating technical references and reviewing recent reports.
questions.funFact: Audit teams must obtain updated technical manuals and study prior monthly reports before departure.

questions.question: During a regional office audit, what should be checked about operator documents?
options: Presence and currency of approved documents like AMO PM, MCM and C of A photocopies
questions.correctAnswer: Presence and currency of approved documents like AMO PM, MCM and C of A photocopies
questions.hint: Auditors verify that required documents are available and current.
questions.funFact: Audits include checking mini-library documents and operators' maintenance manuals for currency.

questions.question: How often should HODAWS send updates of aircraft file changes to corporate HQ?
questions.correctAnswer: Quarterly (every 3 months)
questions.hint: Periodic (3-month) updates are required.
questions.funFact: Regional offices must send quarterly updates (e.g., C of A status, inspection findings) to HQ.

questions.question: What is the role of the Principal Airworthiness Inspector (PAI)?
options: Primary point of contact and lead inspector for an operator or AMO
questions.correctAnswer: Primary point of contact and lead inspector for an operator or AMO
questions.hint: PAI leads the team assigned to an operator and handles oversight services.
questions.funFact: PAIs lead surveillance and approval activities for assigned operators and AMOs.

questions.question: What should be included in the team's preparation before an audit departure?
options: List of aircraft types in operator fleets and expected documents to audit
questions.correctAnswer: List of aircraft types in operator fleets and expected documents to audit
questions.hint: Audit teams must know what they will check on arrival.
questions.funFact: Teams should note fleet composition and documents expected in the regional office mini-libraries.

questions.question: Which DAWS duty covers RPAS (drones)?
options: Certification and surveillance of RPAS operators and ROC issuance (airworthiness aspect)
questions.correctAnswer: Certification and surveillance of RPAS operators and ROC issuance (airworthiness aspect)
questions.hint: DAWS handles the airworthiness side of RPAS operations.
questions.funFact: The manual includes RPAS certification and surveillance under ACCA responsibilities.

questions.question: Which activity ensures traceability and control of aircraft parts?
options: Traceability of aircraft parts and monitoring of service bulletins
questions.correctAnswer: Traceability of aircraft parts and monitoring of service bulletins
questions.hint: Traceability helps ensure parts are legitimate and airworthy.
questions.funFact: DAWS monitors service bulletins and enforces traceability of parts to protect continued airworthiness.

questions.question: What action may DAWS publish when an inspection finds a mandatory safety corrective item?
options: An Airworthiness Directive directed to all operators
questions.correctAnswer: An Airworthiness Directive directed to all operators
questions.hint: Mandatory corrective actions are formalised and issued to operators.
questions.funFact: If inspections reveal a defect requiring action, DAWS can publish an airworthiness directive for compliance.

questions.question: Which of these is part of DAWS’ role in relation to foreign airworthiness directives?
options: Review and determine applicability, then direct corrective action if needed
questions.correctAnswer: Review and determine applicability, then direct corrective action if needed
questions.hint: Foreign directives are assessed for relevance to national aircraft.
questions.funFact: DAWS analyzes foreign ADs/SBs and decides national applicability and corrective steps.

questions.question: What must an ASI do if they learn of a suspected regulatory contravention during an inspection?
options: Inform supervisor and take appropriate enforcement or legal steps
Take a picture and post on social media
questions.correctAnswer: Inform supervisor and take appropriate enforcement or legal steps
questions.hint: Serious contraventions require escalation and enforcement action.
questions.funFact: The PPM requires notifying supervisors and following compliance/enforcement procedures when contraventions are found.

questions.question: Which of the following is a recommended content of an ASI's monthly record of activities?
options: How their time was used and tasks performed
questions.correctAnswer: How their time was used and tasks performed
questions.hint: Records should show workload and time allocation.
questions.funFact: Each ASI must submit a monthly record of activities showing how their time was utilised (minimum 40 hrs/week).

questions.question: What should be included in an executive summary of technical assignments sent to DAWS?
options: Personal opinions unrelated to the task
questions.correctAnswer: Only findings and recommendations
questions.hint: Detail stays in the technical file; summary highlights findings/recommendations.
questions.funFact: Executive summaries should stress findings and recommendations and reference details kept in technical files.

questions.question: Who is the only person authorised to approve amendments to the DAWS PPM?
questions.correctAnswer: Director of Airworthiness Standards
questions.hint: Amendments must be authorised at directorate leadership level.
questions.funFact: The PPM states the Director of Airworthiness Standards authorises amendments; staff can propose changes using the feedback sheet.

questions.question: Which item is part of DAWS internal functions for office duties?
options: Record of Activities sheets and annual work programme submission
questions.correctAnswer: Record of Activities sheets and annual work programme submission
questions.hint: These are administrative duties listed in the manual.
questions.funFact: ASIs must submit an annual work programme and monthly records of activity as part of internal functions.

questions.question: What should an inspector do before deviating substantially from prescribed PPM procedures?
options: Notify Director, DAWS as soon as possible and provide full details
Do nothing and hope for the best
questions.correctAnswer: Notify Director, DAWS as soon as possible and provide full details
questions.hint: Major deviations must be reported and justified.
questions.funFact: If a staff member needs to deviate from procedure, the DAWS Director must be notified with full reasons.
